name: Mount Pierce

trails_config.name: Crawford Path
trails_config.description: New England’s oldest continuously used mountain trail leads gently to Mount Pierce. This is a family-friendly hike with moderate grades all the way to treeline. The final push rewards hikers with a beautiful open summit outlook encompassing Mount Washington and the southern Presidential Range. It’s a favorite for winter hikers and beginners tackling the high peaks.
trails_config.parking_info: Crawford Path Trailhead (AMC Highland Center), US-302

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Pierce rises to 4312 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4312 feet, Mount Pierce is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Crawford Path**, a **6.2 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Jackson**, which is just 1.7 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
